segments.text: I notice the boy is standing on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie, and neither of them seems to care about the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse, and the floor is slippery from all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed any of this yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and her foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get hurt if she doesn’t turn around soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on those cookies that he doesn’t even see how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR
